venue.name: The Auditorium at Town Hall in West hartford

item.description:
Celebrate the Year of the Snake 2013
with
SunDo Healing Arts and Wu Healing Center
as they present an amazing lineup of speakers,
exhibits and demonstrations for Taoist Healing Arts Fair.


9 am to 5 pm
February 16, 2013
West Hartford Town Hall Auditorium & Conference Center

$20 online registration until February 14!  

Go to www.wuhealing.com > Events > Taoist Fair

$30 at the door!  ... For more information, please call 800-990-9332.

Scroll Down to see a complete schedule of workshops!

 

 

10:00 Erik Harris ~ This workshop is specifically formulated for people with arthritis,fibromyalgia, MS, Lyme disease rheumatoid arthritis, allergies, and any other immune deficiency condition. Qi Gong exercises to strengthen immunity will be taught. Changes in diet,
teas, Chinese herbs, crystals, and aromatherapy will be discussed. Specific Acupoints on the ear and meridians of the body for immunity will be shown. Erik Harris has been practicing Qi Gong and Tai Chi for several years and is certified through the Wu Healing Center. He currently teaches at the Wu Healing Center in West Hartford.

11:00 Dr. Ming Wu ~Tui Na Massage for Family & Friends
Doctor of Traditional Chinese Medicine, Ming Wu, teaches students to use basic Tui Na hand techniques to give basic but effective massage to others. Tui Na directly affects the flow of energy by pressing the body at acupressure points and is designed to prevent problems, as well
as correct them. Dr. Ming Wu, Ph.D. holds a doctorate in Traditional Chinese Medicine and is director of Wu Healing Center. After teaching in his native China, he came to the US and now also teaches both Tui Na & Qi Gong healing arts.

12:00 Laura Mignosa ~ Common Cures & Chinese Herbs
Learn the herbal equivalent to many over-the-counter drugs to treat many common disharmonies. The class will discuss herbal formulas for stomach ailments, arthritis, back pain,
flu’s & colds, etc… in addition to purchasing tips and information on how these herbs are farmed and manufactured. Laura Mignosa is a nationally certified Chinese herbologist, director of the CT Institute for Herbal Studies since 1992 and is both Western and China trained. Learn more about her private practice at the www.CTHerbSchool.com

1:00 Lisl Meredith Huebner ~ Lyme disease and Traditional Chinese Medicine One size does NOT fit all. How the treatment of pathogens in TCM is successfully applied to
this local epidemic.

2:00 Master Hyunmoon Kim ~ Join Taoist Master Hyunmoon Kim to discover how Taoist breath work improves emotional health and leads us toward our spiritual dimension. Deep meditative breathing a!ects our core navel chakra, which stabilizes emotions and creates spiritual connections
in personal life, work, family, community, and nature. Master Kim is one of a handful of master teachers trained by Taoist hermits from the mountains of Korea. A Professor of SunDo-Taoist Studies at Hanseo University in South Korea, and a PH.D. Graduate of Philosophy in Human Science.

3:00 Stan Baker ~ With over 30 years in the healing and martial arts "eld, Stan Baker will cover some of the main requirements that are needed to understand and train in one’s Taiji. There is a reason why Taiji was known for its unusual powers which will be covered in this workshop.
item.name: Taoist Healing Arts Fair
